result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anfonee Jamaal Hodges

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Anfonee Jamaal Hodges in court.  Attorney Ashley Fard in court for Anfonee Jamaal Hodges.  Attorney Grace M. Gall in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea hearing.  Parties have reached an agreement.  Plea negotiations set forth on the record and agreed upon by the parties.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never own or possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed: Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum
Received and Filed:  Jury Instructions
Received and Filed:  Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Received and Filed:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.
Court modified electronic monitoring from curfew to tracking.  All other previously ordered conditions of bail remain in full effect.

Defendant Anfonee Jamaal Hodges in court.  Attorney Ashley Fard in court for Anfonee Jamaal Hodges.  Attorney Grace M. Gall in court for State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for final pretrial.  Defense requests a modification to electronic monitoring.  State does not object.  Court modified GPS restrictions.  Defense requests a plea date.  Court will address a change of plea at 8:30 am on the day of trial.  State's offer stated on the record.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Jury trial remains scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Plea hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 08-25-2022
Received and Filed:  State's Motion in Limine.
Received and Filed.

Defendant Anfonee Jamaal Hodges in court with attorney Ashley Fard.  Grace M. Gall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a status conference.  Court set final pretrial and jury trial dates upon request from the defense.  Defense acknowledges receipt of discovery.  Court ordered all substantive motions to be filed by July 7, 2022 and all responses to be filed by August 4, 2022 or they will be deemed waived.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 06-09-2022

Court allows release for verified doctor's appointments and verified job interviews.  Defendant must provide proof of child to Justice Point for child's doctor's appointments and must notify Justice Point of any appointments or job interviews at least 24 hours in advance.

Defendant Anfonee Jamaal Hodges in court with Attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Grace M. Gall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for bail/bond hearing.  Court found the State has satisfied victims' rights law.  Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Case adjourned for status in Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Anfonee Jamaal Hodges in court with Attorney Ashley Fard.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests a modification to GPS monitoring.  Court sets a bail/bond hearing date.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 05-04-2022
Filed: Original Transcript of BAIL/BOND HEARING (12 pages) commencing 03-23-2022, by JENSEN WOHLGEMUTH.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Violation Report 03-31-2022

22RM016778  Actual Date Bond Posted with *Sheriff
3/23/2022

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring, 24 hour curfew with the exception of verified employment and medical appointments. No alternative cash bail.

Attorney Ashley Fard in court, defendant Anfonee Jamaal Hodges not in court, in custody.  Grace M. Gall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a bail bond hearing. Bail motion by defense argued and GRANTED by the Court. Defense requested a scheduling conference date. Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.

Defendant Anfonee Jamaal Hodges in court with Attorney Ashley Fard; both appear by video.  Defendant Anfonee Jamaal Hodges in custody.  Samantha Raygo appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective J. Ivy.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Defense to be heard on bail on the next date. Next date provided by the clerk in Br. 40. Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for March 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Ashley Fard in court, defendant Anfonee Jamaal Hodges not in court, in custody.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is out ill. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Ashley Fard in court, defendant Anfonee Jamaal Hodges not in court, in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Defendants appearance is waived. Defense requests an adjournment; needs time to review the matter with her client. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with JRC
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Anfonee Jamaal Hodges in court with attorney Thomas R. Reed.  Defendant Anfonee Jamaal Hodges in custody.  Mario Fiumefreddo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
